@AonSciath I'm saying they can be made relatable without cutting costumes and inserting dated memes.
@AonSciath Changing other people's movies or TV programs isn't acceptable, and I'm not sure what about games makes that acceptable.
@AonSciath But they're changing more than cultural references and jokes, and without any valid reason.
@AonSciath Translators are there to translate. If they want to be the artist or writer for the game, they're in the wrong line of work.
@AonSciath And they should be free to share and enjoy it, if it's their own work. Changing someone else's is not okay, though.
@AonSciath It doesn't give them the right to ruin it for everyone else, though.
@AonSciath That's fine if they want to make their own relatable game for their tastes, then.
@AonSciath @Radia_a_a @Xenomorphica They're changing someone else's work. If they want the memes, they're free to make their own game.
@AonSciath @Radia_a_a @Xenomorphica They can and have, but they need to be part of the original work. They can't be added by translators.
@AonSciath @Xenomorphica Fan translators have shown it wouldn't be awkward to do a straight translation. It's not their artwork to change.
@AonSciath @Xenomorphica @Radia_a_a I've been asking why those costume changes are necessary this entire time.
@AonSciath @Xenomorphica @Radia_a_a I just want to know what you meant by a "translation thing". I trust it's worth changing someone's work.
@AonSciath @Radia_a_a @Xenomorphica They're free to develop their own meme-infested games, but the line stops with the artwork of others.
@AonSciath @Xenomorphica @Radia_a_a Also, what is a "translation thing"? You lost me there, I'm not sure where the artistic license comes in
@AonSciath @Xenomorphica Censorship to the translation of a foreign film isn't acceptable, so why is it accepted and defended with games?
@AonSciath @Xenomorphica @Radia_a_a Why are the changes necessary, though? What is so hard about bringing us the game Japanese players got?
